name: VRDR
title: Vital Records Death Reporting FHIR Implementation Guide

contact.name: Cynthia Bush, Health Scientist (Informatics), CDC/National Center for Health Statistics
AbdulMalik Shakir, FHL7, President and Chief Informatics Scientist Hi3 Solutions

description:
The VRDR FHIR IG provides guidance regarding the use of FHIR resources as a conduit for data required in the bidirectional exchange of mortality data between State-run Public Health Agencies (PHA) Vital Records offices and U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)/National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS).

Bidirectional exchange of mortality data between PHA Vital Records offices and NCHS is essential to effective public health surveillance and emergency response efforts. Automation of the reporting process adds efficiencies that dramatically improves the efficacy of event response, data analysis, and evidence-based measurable prevention of the causes of death.

The VRDR FHIR IG will provide guidance for the use of standard FHIR resources as a conduit for data required by vital records death reporting. The use of FHIR as a platform for automation of vital records death reporting is expected to improve existing automation by enabling wide-scale adoption and leveraging the potential of electronic health records and clinical decision support systems.

The VRDR FHIR IG will lay a foundation for expansion of automated standards-driven information exchange to include tributary flows of information from entities such as physicians, medical examiners, coroners, funeral directors, and family members to public health agencies and between public health agencies and secondary users of detailed mortality data and aggregate statistics.

This FHIR implementation guide is the primary work product of [project #1475](https://bit.ly/34DRIoA) "Vital Records Mortality and Morbidity Reporting FHIR IG" sponsored by the Health Level Seven (HL7) Public Health Work Group (PHWG). 

The scope of the project is to produce and ballot a Standard for Trail Use (STU) Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) implementation guide (IG) for use in reporting of death events to the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics (NCHS) by State and Local Public Health Agencies (PHA). The VRDR FHIR IG is based upon FHIR R4. The VRDR FHIR IG was successfully balloted as a standard for trial use (STU) in May 2019.

This is a U.S. Realm Specification. This guide and related materials are based on reporting specifications in U.S. jurisdictions. The data content of this IG are based upon the [U.S. Standard Certificate of Death](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/dvs/DEATH11-03final-ACC.pdf).

grouping.name: A. Decedent Demographics
grouping.description: Decedent Demographics is a profile group comprised of profiles containing decedent demographic data. Demographic data includes information about related persons (Mother, Father, and Spouse) and social determinants such as education level and usual occupation. The information in this profile group are provided by a decedent informant.

grouping.name: B. Death Investigation
grouping.description: Death Investigation is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data obtained during the course of investigating a death. Many of these items are conditionally present in a death certification transaction depending on whether or not a autopsy was performed, an injury incident occurred, or a transportation event was involved.

grouping.name: C. Death Certification
grouping.description: Death Certification is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data related to the primary concern of the VRDR IG, Death Certification. In this group the causes of death and the causal pathway are documented and attested to by a death certifier (coroner or medical examiner).

grouping.name: D. Decedent Disposition
grouping.description: Decedent Disposition is a profile group comprised of profiles containing data related to the disposition of the decedents remains. The data in this profile group is typically provided by the funeral home performing the disposition services. The content of this profile group is authenticated by the funeral home director.

grouping.name: Extensions
grouping.description: Resources used to extend base FHIR resources to meet unique requirements of Vital Records Death Reporting.

grouping.name: Instance Examples
grouping.description: A collection of VRDR FHIR IG resource profile instance examples.

resource.name: VRDR Decedent
resource.description: The Decedent's Education Level resource represents the highest level of education achieved by the decedent. The VRDR Decedent's Education Level profile builds upon the FHIR Observation resource.

resource.name: VRDR Decedent Age
resource.description: The Decedent Age resource represents the decedent's chronological age at the time of death. Age is derived as the difference in time between the decedent's death date and birth date. The VRDR Decedent Age profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation Resource.

resource.name: VRDR Examiner Contacted
resource.description: The Examiner Contacted resource represents an indication as to whether a medical examiner (or coroner) was contacted to conduct an investigation and certify the causes of death. The VRDR Examiner Contacted profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Disposition Location
resource.description: The Disposition Location resource represents the place/location where the decedent's remains were disposed of. The VRDR Disposition Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.

resource.name: Decedent's Mother
resource.description: The Decedent's Mother resource represents the maternal parent of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Mother profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Related Person resource.

resource.name: VRDR Decedent Pregnancy
resource.description: The Decedent Pregnancy resource provides an indication of the pregnancy status of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Pregnancy profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Decedent Spouse
resource.description: The Decedent Spouse resource represents the surviving spouse of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Spouse profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Related Person resource.

resource.name: VRDR Decedent Transportation Role
resource.description: The Decedent Transportation Role resource is used to specify the role of the decedent (e.g. driver, passenger, pedestrian, other) in a transportation-related injury. The VRDR Decedent Transportation Role profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Funeral Home
resource.description: The Funeral Home resource represents the business entity conducting ceremony connected with the final disposition of the decedent's remains, such as a burial or cremation, with the attendant observances. The VRDR Funeral Home profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Organization resource.

resource.name: Interested Party
resource.description: The Interested Party resource represents a business entity that assigns one or more identifiers to a death certificate document. Assigning authorities for death certificate identifiers include coroners and medical examiners, local and state public health agencies, and the national center for health statistics. The VRDR Interested Party profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Organization resource.

resource.name: VRDR Manner of Death
resource.description: The Manner of Death resource represents the conclusion arrived at upon completion of death investigation regarding the manner of death (eg., natural, homicide, suicide, accident, ...). The VRDR Manner of Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Mortician
resource.description: The Mortician resource represents the professional practitioner preceding over the funeral services involved in the disposition of the decedent's remains. The VRDR Mortician profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resource.

resource.name: Tobacco Use Contributed To Death
resource.description: The Tobacco Use Contributed To Death resource represents the conclusion arrived at during death investigation regarding the extent to which tobacco use contributed to the death of the decedent. The VRDR Tobacco Use Contributed To Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Injury Location
resource.description: The Injury Location resource represents the general place (such as restaurant, vacant lot, or home) where a decedent's death-related injury occurred. The VRDR Injury Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.

resource.name: VRDR Autopsy Performed Indicator
resource.description: The Autopsy Performed Indicator profile provides an indication as to whether an autopsy was performed and if so, indicates whether the results of the autopsy are available. The Autopsy Performed Indicator profile builds upon the FHIR Observation resource.

resource.name: Cause Of Death Condition
resource.description: The Cause Of Death Condition resource represents a clinically relevant condition --disease, injury, or complication-- in the causal pathway of events that directly caused the death. The VRDR Cause of Death Condition profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Condition resource.

resource.name: Certifier
resource.description: The Certifier resource represents the practitioner (coroner, medical examiner, or physician) who certifies death, the manner of death, and the causes of death. The VRDR Cerfifier profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resource.

resource.name: VRDR Condition Contributing To Death
resource.description: The Condition Contributing To Death resource represents a significant condition contributing to death but not resulting in the underlying cause. The VRDR Condition Contributing To Death profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Condition resource.

resource.name: VRDR Death Certificate
resource.description: The Death Certificate resource represents the body of the death certificate document that lays in order to the bundle of resources comprising the death certificate document. The VRDR Death Certificate profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Composition resource.

resource.name: VRDR Death Certificate Document
resource.description: The Death Certificate Document resource is the bundle of resources that comprise the death certificate. The VRDR Death Certificate Document profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Bundle resource.

resource.name: Death Certification
resource.description: The Death Certification resource represents the act of certifying death. The VRDR Death Certification profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Procedure resource.

resource.name: VRDR Death Location
resource.description: The Death Location resource represents the decedent's place of death. The VRDR Death Location profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Location resource.

resource.name: Death Pronouncement Performer
resource.description: The Death Pronouncement Performer resource represents the health practitioner that declared the decedent dead. The VRDR Death Pronouncement Performer profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Practitioner resouce.

resource.name: VRDR Within City Limits Indicator
resource.description: The Within City Limits Indicator resource is an extension to the FHIR Address Datatype. It is used to indicate if the decedent's residential address is a location within the limits of the address city.

resource.name: VRDR Injury Incident
resource.description: The Injury Incident resource represents observations (time, location, and work or transportation-related), discovered regarding an injury event during a death investigation. The VRDR Injury Incident profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Birth Record Identifier
resource.description: The Birth Record Identifier resource is a reference to a birth record used as a linkage. The VRDR Birth Record Identifier profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: VRDR Cause of Death Pathway
resource.description: The Cause of Death Pathway resource documents the ordered chain conditions in the causal pathway chain of events with a causal relationship to the decedent's death. The VRDR Cause of Death Pathway profile builds upon the FHIR R4 List resource.

resource.name: Death Certificate Reference
resource.description: The Death Certificate Reference resource enables interested parties to assign local identifiers to the death certificate document. The Death Certificate Reference profile builds upon the FHIR Document Reference resource.

resource.name: Decedent Disposition Method
resource.description: The Decedent Disposition Method resource specifies the means by which the decedent's remains were disposed of.  The VRDR Decedent Disposition Method profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Death Date
resource.description: The Death Date resource is used to convey the actual or presumed date of death for the decedent. If the date of death unable to be determined then the date the decedent's remains were discovered serves as a surrogate for the death date. The VRDR Death Date resource profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource. The date the decedent was pronounced dead is included as a component of the death date observation.

resource.name: Decedent's Usual Work
resource.description: The Decedent Usual Work resource is used to convey the usual work industry and occupation of the decedent. The base profile is lifted directly out of the Occupational Data for Health (ODH), Release 1.0 FHIR Implementation Guide (http://hl7.org/fhir/us/odh/).

resource.name: Decedent Military Service
resource.description: The Decedent Military Service resource is used to convey whether the decedent was ever in the US armed forces. The VRDR Decedent Military Service profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Observation resource.

resource.name: Decedent Father
resource.description: The Decedent's Father resource represents the paternal parent of the decedent. The VRDR Decedent Father profile builds upon the FHIR R4 Related Person resource.

resource.name: Funeral Service Licensee
resource.description: The Funeral Service Licensee resource represents the professional practitioner affiliated with the funeral home that has met the requirements to be a funeral director and/or an embalmer. The VRDR Funeral Service Licensee profile builds upon the FHIR R4 PractitionerRole resource.

resource.name: Decedent
resource.description: The decedent resource represents the deceased person that is the subject of the vital record death report. The VRDR Decedent profile builds upon the US-Core Patient profile.

resource.name: Observation Location
resource.description: Observation Location is an extension of the FHIR Observation resource. It is the location of the observed phenomenon or entity that is the subject of the observation. Use to enable the specification of locations such as the location of injury, the location of death, and the location of disposition.

resource.name: Autopsy Performed Indicator Instance Example
resource.description: Instance example of the Autopsy Performed Indicator resource profile. This example indicates that an autopsy was performed and that the results of the autopsy are available.

resource.name: Decedent Instance Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR Decedent resource profile. Mr. Example Last, a White, Native Hawaiian, Hispanic male born 1940-02-19 and residing in Middlesex, MA.

resource.name: Birth Record Identifier Example
resource.description: An instance example of the Birth Record Identifier resource profile.  In this example Birth Record identifier 4242123 denotes Massachusetts and 1940 as the birthplace and birth year of the decedent.

resource.name: Certifier Instance Example
resource.description: An instance example of a Certifier resource profile. This example is a certifying physician.

resource.name: Death Certification Instance Example
resource.description: An instance example of a Death Certification resource profile. This example Death Certification procedure performed by a physician on 2019-01-29.

resource.name: Interested Party Instance Example
resource.description: An instance example of the Interested Party resource profile. In the example, Example Hospital from MA is an active Healthcare Provider interested party.

resource.name: Condition Contributing To Death Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Condition-Contributing-To-Death resource profile. In this example, the condition is noted as text only. This is typical of a death record outbound from a jurisdictional EDRS to the NCHS.

resource.name: Decedent Age Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Age resource profile. In this example, the decedent is identified as 79 years in age.

resource.name: Death Date Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Date resource profile. In this example, the date and time of death is 2018-02-20T16:48:06-05:00. The Date and time pronounced dead is also  2018-02-20T16:48:06-05:00.

resource.name: Injury Location Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Injury-Location resource profile.

resource.name: Tobacco Use Contributed To Death Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Tobacco-Use-Contributed-To-Death resource profile.

resource.name: Examiner Contacted Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Examiner-Contacted resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Pregnancy Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Pregnancy resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Disposition Method Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Disposition-Method resource profile.

resource.name: Mortician Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Mortician resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Military Service Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Military-Service

resource.name: Decedent Education Level Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Education-Level resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Mother Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Mother resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Spouse Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Spouse example.

resource.name: Decedent Father Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Father resource profile.

resource.name: Manner of Death Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Manner-of-Death resource profile.

resource.name: Cause Of Death Condition Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Cause-Of-Death-Condition resource profile.

resource.name: Cause of Death Pathway Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Cause-of-Death-Pathway resource profile.

resource.name: Funeral Home Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Funeral-Home resource profile.

resource.name: Funeral Service Licensee Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Funeral-Service-Licensee resource profile.

resource.name: Death Certificate Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Certificate resource profile.

resource.name: Disposition Location Example
resource.description: Instance example of the VRDR-Disposition-Location resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Transportation Role Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Transportation-Role resource profile.

resource.name: Injury Incident Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-InjuryIncident resource profile.

resource.name: Decedent Usual Work Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Decedent-Usual-Work resource profile.

resource.name: Death Pronouncement Performer Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Pronouncement-Performer resource profile

resource.name: Death Certificate Document Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Certificate-Document resource profile.

resource.name: Death Certificate Reference Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Certificate-Reference resource profile.

resource.name: Death Location Example
resource.description: An instance example of the VRDR-Death-Location resource profile.

resource.name: LocationJurisdictionId
resource.description: An extension intended for use in an FHIR Location resource to identify the national case reporting jurisdiction under which the location falls. The jurisdiction identifier can be express as a string or as a code value from the [PHVS_USVitalRecordsJurisdictions_NCHS](https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueSet.action?id=282D4DD8-39EA-4C5B-B8A9-B2C3E5878A15#) value set.

reference.display: Extension - Partial Date Part Absent Reason

resource.name: Extension - Partial Date Part Absent Reason
resource.description: This extension enables an incomplete date to be expressed with reasons provided for missing date components.

resource.name: Bypass Edit Flag
resource.description: An extension used to indicate the rationale behind the inclusion of data values that bypass edit criteria for the resource element.

resource.name: Address City Code
resource.description: The address city code extension is used to enable the city portion of address to be expressed as a numeric value in accordance with the NCHS Instruction Manual Part 8, Vital Records Geographic Classification, 2014 (https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/dvs/IMP8_2014.pdf).

resource.name: NVSS Ethnicity
resource.description: An extension used to indicate the ethnicity of a decedent.

resource.name: Edit Bypass 01
resource.description: A subset of code values (0 and 1) use to indicate the outcome of data validation assessment for unusual data values.

resource.name: Edit Bypass 0124
resource.description: A subset of code values (0, 1, 2, and 4) use to indicate the outcome of data validation assessment for unusual data values.

resource.name: Edit Bypass 01234
resource.description: A subset of code values (0, 1, 2, 3, and 4) use to indicate the outcome of data validation assessment for unusual data values.

resource.name: Edit Bypass 012
resource.description: A subset of code values (0, 1, and 2) use to indicate the outcome of data validation assessment for unusual data values.

resource.name: Education Level
resource.description: A value set of educational milestones used to identify the highest level of education achieved by the decedent.

resource.name: Marital Status
resource.description: The set of codes used to indicate the marital status of the decedent.

resource.name: Administrative Gender
resource.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

resource.name: Yes No NotApplicable
resource.description: A set of codes used to express an affirmative response (Yes), negative response (No), or indicate that a response is not applicable (NA) with regard to the question posed.

resource.name: Yes No Unknown
resource.description: A set of codes used to express an affirmative response (Yes), negative response (No), or indicate that an applicable response is not known (Unknown) with regard to the question posed.

resource.name: Manner of Death
resource.description: A set of codes used to indicate a manner of death classification.

resource.name: Place of Death
resource.description: Code values reflecting the death location of the decedent (e.g., hospital, home, hospice).

resource.name: Method of Disposition
resource.description: The set of codes used to indicate the method used to dispose of the decedents remains.

resource.name: Race Missing Value Reason
resource.description: A set of code values used to indicate the reason decedent race data is absent.

resource.name: Yes No Unknown NotApplicable
resource.description: A set of codes used to express an affirmative response (Yes), negative response (No), or indicate that a response is not applicable (NA) or unknown (UNK) with regard to the question posed.

resource.name: Transportation Incident Role
resource.description: A set of codes indicating the role of the decedent in an injury involving a transportation vehicle.

resource.name: NVSS Race
resource.description: An extension used to indicate the decedent's race categories.
